text: Robin Hull, born August 16, 1974, in England, is a Finnish professional snooker player and the only professional player from that country. == Career == He has made more than 135 centuries during his career, making him one of the players who has made the most breaks at this level among those who have been in the top 16 in the world. Hull is, with Ken Doherty, Thepchaiya Un- Nooh, Barry Pinches and Mark Selby, one of the five players who missed the last black ball to complete the famous maximum break of 147 points. == References == Category:1974 births Category:Living people
title: Robin Hull
